votings.borda-nauru: Nauru's Borda Count or Borda Dowdall (1/n)

avElection.thisisATest: Advarsel! Dette er et TEST-valg
avElection.locatorDescription: Når du avlegger din stemme vises sporings-IDen til din stemmeseddel og du kan spore den uten å avsløre hva du har stemt. Her kan du legge inn sporings-ID for å kontrollere at en bestemt, kryptert stemmeseddel ble levert og er med i resultatet.
avElection.locatorFoundText: Stemmeseddel funnet! Stemmeseddelen med sporings-ID __locator__ er inkludert i resultatet. Teksten er:
avElection.errorLoadingText: Problem med å laste resultatet. Det kan være at resultatet ikke har blitt publisert, at du ikke har tilgang eller at valget ikke eksisterer.
avElection.stateNotPublished: Beklager: Resultatet kan ikke bli vist fordi det ikke har blitt offentliggjort enda.

public.errorLoadingText: Kunne ikke laste inn valget. Dette valget eksisterer kanskje ikke, eller det har ikke blitt gjort offentlig tilgjengelig.
public.questionInfoText: Velgere vil velge mellom __min__ og __max__ kandidater. __numWinners__ winners.

authorities.title: Valgautoriteter
authorities.intro: Valgautoritetene spiller en nøkkelrolle. Sikkerhetssystemet som benyttes i dette valget består av flere krypteringsnøkler som gis ut til flere uavhengige valgautoritenene. Disse sikrer et hemmelig valg og korrektheten av resultatet. Dette er valgautoritetene:

verifyResults.title: Kontrollerbar opptelling av valget
verifyResults.subtitle: Valg: __title__
verifyResults.stateNotPublished: Beklager. Resultatet kan ikke kontrolleres fordi valgresultatet ikke har blitt publisert enda.
verifyResults.verifyText:
Teksten under er på engelsk for å miste minst mulig av det tekniske innholdet. Den beskriver i detalj hvordan du kan verifisere resultatet av valget: In this page we will describe the process through which it is possible to verify that the result of an election is valid. Each voter can verify that his/her cast ballot is included in the tally, and can also verify mathematically the result of the tally.

To perform that verification it is required to have a technical background. If you do not have it, we recommend to execute this verification process with the help of somebody with a technical background.

The first thing you need to verify the tally is to download the "election-verifier" software. This is the program that performs the needed verifications over an __name__ election. You can download election-verifier from here:

election-verifier (sha256sum: {{verifier.hash}})

or you can install it manually from the source code, following the instructions in github.

election-verifier has been tested to work in Linux, and requires:

  • A 64 bits Linux Operative System.
  • Python 3.3 o later
  • Java v7 o later installed.
  • uuencode ("sudo apt-get install sharutils" en Debian/Ubuntu).

The file that contains the data of the election, that we usually call "tally.tar" is the following one:

Election tally ({{electionId}}.tar)

To verify the tally, you can simply execute:

sh election-verifier {{electionId}}.tar

The output of the that execution will be something similar to the following:

sh election-verifier {{electionId}}.tar

* extracted to /tmp/tmp9c2r5e3jtally
* extracted raw tally to /tmp/tmp9c2r5e3jtally/tally-raw-0
* running ['./tally-pipes', '-t', '/tmp/tmp9c2r5e3jtally/0.tar.gz', '-c', '/tmp/tmp9c2r5e3jtally/config.json', '-s', '-o', 'json']
* results hash verification OK
* processing /tmp/tmp9c2r5e3jtally/tally-raw-0
# Results ##########################################
total number of votes (including blank/invalid votes): 37
Question #1: Secretario General

number of options available: 2

Raw winning options (position):
...


####################################################

* verifying proofs of knowledge of the plaintexts...
* ..finished. Verified 37 votes (0 invalid)
* proofs of knowledge of plaintexts OK (0 invalid)
* running './pverify.sh .rnd /tmp/tmp9c2r5e3jtally/tally-raw-0'
* initializing random source..Successfully initialized random source!
* begin proof verification on '/tmp/tmp9c2r5e3jtally/tally-raw-0'
* processing /tmp/tmp9c2r5e3jtally/tally-raw-0/0-089b56b3-3ffc-4f91-ace5-eef571162d8c..
*
* ============ Read and derive common values. ====================
* 150101 18:46:10 Read joint public key... * done.
* 150101 18:46:11 Read individual El Gamal public keys... * done.
* 150101 18:46:11 Verify relation between public keys... * done.
* 150101 18:46:11 Read input ciphertexts... * done.
* 150101 18:46:11 Derive independent generators... * done.
*
* ============ Verify shuffle of Party 1. ========================
* 150101 18:46:11 Read output of Party 1... * done.
* 150101 18:46:11 Verify proof of shuffle... * done.
*
* ============ Verify shuffle of Party 2. ========================
* 150101 18:46:12 Read output of Party 2... * done.
* 150101 18:46:12 Verify proof of shuffle... * done.
*
* ============ Verify decryption of Party 1. =====================
* 150101 18:46:12 Read decryption factors... * done.
* 150101 18:46:12 Verify decryption proof... * done.
*
* ============ Verify decryption of Party 2. =====================
* 150101 18:46:13 Read decryption factors... * done.
* 150101 18:46:13 Verify decryption proof... * done.
*
* ============ Verify finalization. ==============================
* 150101 18:46:13 Decrypt using verified decryption factors... * done.
* 150101 18:46:13 Read and verify plaintexts... * done.
*
* Verification completed SUCCESSFULLY after 0h 0m 4s.
* verification is OK
* processing question_dir 0-089b56b3-3ffc-4f91-ace5-eef571162d8c
* running '/tmp/tmp.J9d7GWUECw/election-verifier/vmnc.sh .rnd -plain -outi json proofs/PlaintextElements.bt plaintexts_json2'
* initializing random source..Successfully initialized random source!
* calling mixnet interface with vmnc .rnd -plain -outi json proofs/PlaintextElements.bt plaintexts_json2..
* vmnc call succeeded
* plaintexts_json verification OK
* running '/tmp/tmp.J9d7GWUECw/election-verifier/vmnc.sh .rnd -ciphs -ini json ciphertexts_json ciphertexts_raw'
* calling mixnet interface with vmnc .rnd -ciphs -ini json ciphertexts_json ciphertexts_raw..
* vmnc call succeeded
* ciphertexts_json verification OK

The most important thing is that the command finishes saying "OK". If there is any failure, the command will not finish saying OK but FAILED. We will now list the steps involved in the verification. For technical reasons the command doesn't follow the exact same order as listed in here, but we still list them this way for clarity:

  1. Extract the file in a directory whose path is printed in the screen
  2. Show in the screen briefly the most important data of the tally: number of votes and the list of winning options (NOT in order).
  3. Read the result_json file that corresponds with the results of the tally shown in the previous step and hash it.
  4. Read the publick keys with which the ballots where encrypted (file pubkeys_json)
  5. Read the ballots from the file ciphertexts_json and check the validity of the Zero Knownledge Proofs (ZKP) mathematical proofs that prove that the person that encrypted the ballot knew the plain text content of the ballot.
  6. The next step is to verify some elements from each question. Each question is encrypted separately, and thus the tally and some verifications are made also separately:
    1. Verify that starting with the ballot of the file "ciphertexts_json" it can be obtained the encrypted ballot in raw format. A hash of both files is made and it is checked that the result is the same. If this verification fails, the script prints on the screen "ciphertexts_json verification FAILED".
    2. Read the ZKP proofs that mathematically prove that starting with the encrypted ballots of this question, the result is the decrypted ballots in raw format. If these proofs fail, the script prints "verification FAILED".
    3. Verify that the decrypted ballots in raw format can be converted in the result ballots in text format of the file "plaintexts_json". A hash of both files is made and it is checked that both match. If this check fails, the script prints "plaintexts_json verification FAILED".
  7. Read the file that contains the decrypted votes, and calculate the tally of the election from that data.
  8. Check that the hash of that file matches the hash of result_json obtained in step 3. If the comparison fails, the script prints "tally verification FAILED".

    9. As can be seen, it is mathematically and univocally proved that starting with the encrypted ballots, the election tally is correct. Some questions might be raised: where are all those ballots coming from? is my ballot included?

    First, we have to say that the voting system implies the need of some trust in the organizations running the election, especially it is assumed that no ballot stuffing has not happened. This is a limitation (reflected in the tecnical overview, section 6.3.3) that stems from the fact the ballots are not digitally signed, and they are not because very few people have a digital certificate that they can easily use in an election of this kind.In other european countries like for example Estonia, e-ID seems to have widespread use and thus 24,3% of the electorate voted through Internet in 2011 elections.

    Nevertheless, it can be mathematically proved that your individual ballot, the one that you cast as voter, is included in the list of encrypted ballots, in that list we have verified to generate the correct election result. To verify your vote, you need to have saved the ballot tracker, which is just a hash of the ballot.

    This ballot tracker appears in the screen when you finish the voting process of the voting booth. If you do not saved your ballot tracker, remember that you have to save it if you want to be able to perform this verification.

    To check that your ballot is included in the tally, you simply need to execute the same command as before, adding as a parameter your ballot tracker:

    sh election-verifier {{electionId}}.tar [ballot-tracker]
